articles.title: Kim Jong Un Provides Field Guidance to Wonsan Baby Home and Orphanage Close to Completion
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Provides Field Guidance to Wonsan Baby Home and Orphanage Close to Completion
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, provided field guidance to Wonsan Baby Home and Orphanage close to completion.
					 Enjoying a bird's-eye view of the baby home and orphanage, he expressed great satisfaction, saying those buildings look nice when watching only those exteriors and that just frames stood on dusty land when he inspected them two months ago but the project is close to completion and this area has undergone a dramatic change.
					
					 New nice buildings have sprung up on the socialist paradise where fairylands are appearing one after another, making it possible to realize another long-cherished desire of the great leaders who were always considerate towards orphans, he said.
					
					 Looking round various places of those buildings, he learned in detail about their construction.
					
					 He praised the builders for constructing all rooms of those buildings in the best quality including nursing and  educational rooms, a children's library, room for observing nature, room for playing with intelligence toys, amusement room, playing hall, wading pool, bath, barber's and clinic. 
					
					 He said that all facilities were arranged in a reasonable way so that they might be available for bringing up and educating those children and promoting their growth and developing their intellectual faculties, and that all of them were well built in such a way as to suit their feelings and help them cultivate their creativity and independence.
					
					 He noted with pleasure that the baby home and orphanage have been built at the world's level as the builders used not only tiles for exterior and interior walls and sanitary ware but also outdoor rubber plates, all made at home. This is a proof that a lot of successes have been made in the efforts to implement the party's policy on locally producing building materials, he added.
					
					 The longer I watch the baby home and orphanage, the more fashionable they look both in interior and exterior, he said, noting the construction of these splendid edifices prove that designing and building are making a leap forward in the country with each passing day.
					
					 He underscored the need to make good preparations for operating the baby home and orphanage including the work to build up well the ranks of nurses and kindergarteners and sufficiently provide school things, utensils, materials for their operation, etc. as their construction is near completion.
					
					 Enjoying a bird's-eye view of the baby home and orphanage again and again, he said with joy that they stand impeccable when they are viewed from their front and back. He noted he was pleased to see a nice palace for children to be proud of in the world, crystal of the party's love for the rising generation and future. He added that he felt as if he had seen orphans cheerfully playing free from worries and as if he had plucked a star.
					
					 Saying that the soldier-builders made a lot of efforts, working hard day and night to bring joy to the people, he asked officials to convey his greetings to them. He extended the thanks of the KPA Supreme Commander to them.
					
					 He called upon the soldier-builders to perfectly finish the remaining project so that they may take responsibility for the safety of the project and guarantee its absolute quality for all eternity and thus hold a ceremony for the completion of Wonsan Baby Home and Orphanage with splendor on June 1, the international children's day.
					
					 He was accompanied by KPA Vice Marshal Hwang Pyong So, director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA.

articles.title: Floral Basket, Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps
articles.content:
Floral Basket, Congratulatory Message to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and congratulatory message from the military attaches corps here on the occasion of the 83rd anniversary of the founding of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 They were handed to KPA General Hyon Yong Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, on Wednesday by Zhang Ping, military, naval and air attache of the Chinese embassy here who is doyen of the corps.

articles.title: Reception Given by Syrian Ambassador
articles.content:
Reception Given by Syrian Ambassador
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- A reception was given by Syrian Ambassador to the DPRK Tammam Sulaiman at his embassy on Wednesday on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Present there on invitation were DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong, Minster of Public Health Kang Ha Guk and officials concerned.
					
					 The Syrian ambassador said in his speech the President was born in Mangyongdae as the sun of the Korean nation, embarked upon the road of anti-Japanese armed struggle, defeated the Japanese imperialists and achieved the independence of the country.
					
					 The tradition of struggle bequeathed by him is being successfully carried forward by Kim Jong Un, the supreme leader of the Korean people, he said, adding:
					
					 The DPRK and Syria are standing on the same front to protect the dignity and interests of their peoples from imperialists.
					
					 Ri Su Yong referred to the exploits the President performed by making undying contributions to the development of friendly and cooperative relations with various countries aspiring after independence and to the accomplishment of the global cause of independence.
					
					 The idea and cause of the President are being given steady continuity under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un, he noted, adding:
					
					 The Korean people will as ever extend invariable support and solidarity to the government and people of Syria in their just struggle to protect the sovereignty and territorial integrity of the country from all hostile forces' aggression and build prosperous Syria.

articles.title: Staff Members of Syrian Embassy Visit Kim Il Sung University
articles.content:
Staff Members of Syrian Embassy Visit Kim Il Sung University
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Syrian Ambassador to the DPRK Tammam Sulaiman and staff members of his embassy visited Kim Il Sung University on Wednesday on the occasion of the 69th anniversary of Syria's independence.
					 The guests laid bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il at the university and paid tribute to them. Then they visited the revolutionary museum.
					
					 They went round various rooms, being briefed on the exploits the President and Kim Jong Il performed by building the first university of the people on this land and devoting themselves to developing the university.
					
					 They went round different places of the e-library.
					
					 The ambassador wrote in the visitor's book that the university is the worldwide one clearly showing the President's idea of attaching importance to science as he built the first university of the country at the time when it was suffering difficulties.

articles.title: Political Party of DR Congo Signs Pyongyang Declaration
articles.content:
Political Party of DR Congo Signs Pyongyang Declaration
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The Popular Revolutionary Party of the DR Congo signed the historic Pyongyang Declaration "Let Us Defend and Advance the Cause of Socialism" on April 15.
					 On April 20, Juche 81 (1992) representatives of communist parties, workers' parties and other political parties of foreign countries aspiring after socialism adopted the declaration reflecting the fixed will to defend and advance the socialist cause.
					
					 The Popular Revolutionary Party of the DR Congo discussed and unanimously approved the Pyongyang Declaration at a meeting of its National Executive Committee.
					
					 The acting general secretary of the party inked the declaration.

articles.title: Visit to Bogor Botanical Garden of Indonesia
articles.content:
Visit to Bogor Botanical Garden of Indonesia
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- A ceremony took place on April 14 to visit the Bogor Botanical Garden of Indonesia on the occasions of the 50th anniversary of the Indonesia visit by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the 50th anniversary of the naming of a beautiful flower Kimilsungia.
					 Present there were staff members of the DPRK embassy in Jakarta and employees of the garden.
					
					 The visitors went round photos of the President and Kim Jong Il, a monument and immortal Kimilsungias on display.
					
					 A department director of the garden said that through the visit he keenly felt once again the greatness of the President and the boundless reverence of the Korean people for him.
					
					 The garden will as ever conduct more brisk work for cultivating and disseminating Kimilsungias, he added.
					
					 The director of the tissue culture and orchid wing of the garden and other speakers said that Kimilsungia is blooming as a famous flower conveying long the undying feats the President performed for the cause of global independence and a flower symbolic of the friendship between the two countries.

articles.title: Kimilsungia Exhibition Held in Indonesia
articles.content:
Kimilsungia Exhibition Held in Indonesia
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- A Kimilsungia exhibition was held at a flower garden in Jakarta, Indonesia from April 13 to 16 on the occasions of the 50th anniversary of the historic Indonesia visit by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the 50th anniversary of the naming of a beautiful flower Kimilsungia.
					 Displayed at the exhibition hall were more than 300 potted Kimilsungias in full bloom.
					
					 Also displayed were photos documenting the Indonesia visit by the President and Kim Jong Il and their undying feats.
					
					 On display there were their works, books and photos introducing the flower in full bloom and fine art pieces associated with the creative talents of the Korean people.
					
					 The chairman of the Indonesia-Korea Association for Friendship and Cultural Exchange who is general secretary of the National Guidance Council of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia wished beautiful Kimilsungia reflecting the minds of the Indonesian people would be brought into fuller bloom all over the world.
					
					 The general secretary of the National Leading Council of the Diversity Party of Indonesia said President Sukarno presented the beautiful flower to President of the DPRK Kim Il Sung and named it as Kimilsungia, an expression of the profound trust and unanimous reverence of the Indonesian people for him.
					
					 The chairman in charge of external relations of the Pioneer Party of Indonesia expressed the will to work hard to value and further consolidate the friendship between the two countries provided by the preceding leaders.
					
					 A letter to Marshal Kim Jong Un was adopted at the ceremony.

articles.title: Indonesia-DPRK Joint Stamp Issued
articles.content:
Indonesia-DPRK Joint Stamp Issued
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- A ceremony of issuing the Indonesia-DPRK joint stamp took place in Jakarta on April 15 on the occasions of the 50th anniversary of the Indonesia visit by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and the 50th anniversary of the naming of a beautiful flower Kimilsungia.
					 Present there were personages of the Ministry of Communications and Information Technology, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Philatelists Association of Indonesia and other masses, the DPRK ambassador to Indonesia and his embassy officials and members of the delegation of the Korea Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Committee.
					
					 The participants watched a Korean film documenting the Indonesia visit by the President 50 years ago.
					
					 The special advisor to the minister of Communications and Information Technology in a congratulatory speech said the issue of the joint stamp would help boost the friendship and cooperation between the two countries.
					
					 Kimilsungia is a symbol of the friendship between the two countries, he noted, adding: Indonesia will continue working hard to boost the long-standing excellent relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries.

articles.title: Remains of Former Officials of Chongryon Buried at Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery
articles.content:
Remains of Former Officials of Chongryon Buried at Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Remains of former officials of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) were buried at the Patriotic Martyrs Cemetery with due ceremony on Wednesday. They dedicated themselves to the prosperity of the socialist homeland and the patriotic cause of Chongryon with intense loyalty to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They included Yun Tok Gon, former first chairman of the Union of Korean Educational Association in Japan, Ro Jae Ho, former vice-chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee, Nam Si U, former rector of Korean University of Chongryon, and Kang Chang Su, former first director of the Kwondo Institute of Chongryon.
					
					 Present at the ceremony were Kim Yong Dae, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Kim Jin Guk, director of the Agency of Overseas Korean Affairs, officials of the organs related to overseas Korean affairs, the delegation of Koreans in Japan for celebrating the Day of the Sun (the birth anniversary of Kim Il Sung), Chongryon officials, Koreans in Japan and bereaved family members.
					
					 Kim Yong Dae made a eulogy.
					
					 Remains of the martyrs were buried at the cemetery and wreaths were laid in the name of the Central Standing Committee of Chongryon, the Central Standing Council of the Union of Korean Educational Association in Japan, the Choson Sinbo Company of Chongryon, Korean University of Chongryon, the Kwondo Institute of Chongryon and the organs related to overseas Korean affairs.

articles.title: Foreign Crewmen Observe Anniversary of KPA Founding
articles.content:
Foreign Crewmen Observe Anniversary of KPA Founding
Wonsan, April 22 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held by foreign crewmen at Wonsan Port in Kangwon Province of the DPRK on the occasion of the 83rd anniversary of the founding of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The participants of the meeting laid bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in Wonsan City and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Present at the meeting were the captain and crewmen of a Cambodia-flagged ship.
					
					 Speakers recalled that the President clarified the truth that arms guarantee the existence of a nation and victory of revolution, proclaiming before the world the founding of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army on Apr. 25, 1932.
					
					 The President built regular armed forces without delay even under the complicated situation after Korea's liberation and led the Fatherland Liberation War to victory, thus enabling the Korean people to emerge heroic people who shattered the myth of U.S. imperialists' "mightiness", they said, adding:
					
					 Thanks to the outstanding and tested guidance of leader Kim Jong Il who formulated the Songun politics as the main political mode under socialism, the Korean People's Army developed into an invincible army strong in ideology and faith and equipped with modern offensive and defensive means.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un developed the KPA into the one fully prepared politically and ideologically and in military technique, true to the military idea of the President and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The speakers hoped that the Koreans would register big successes in their efforts for building a thriving nation and accomplishing the cause of national reunification.
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: New Poster Produced
articles.content:
New Poster Produced
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- New poster "Don't Forget Wolf-like U.S. Imperialists" was produced by the Mansudae Art Studio recently. 
					 The poster depicts a woman bitterly condemning the U.S. imperialist aggressors, infuriated by the monstrous massacres of Koreans committed by them after bringing a war disaster to the peaceful land and a baby pitifully crying in her arms when she was tortured by the aggressors during the last Korean war.
					
					 It also depicts brave Korean people unyieldingly fighting against aggressors even on guillotines, holding flags of the DPRK till the last moments of their lives, and wolf-like U.S. imperialists brutally killing them.
					
					 It teaches once again the service personnel and people of the DPRK the immutable truth that they should not have even an iota of illusion about the U.S. imperialists but settle accounts with them by arms only no matter how much water may flow under the bridge.

articles.title: 30th National Sci-Tech Festival Opens
articles.content:
30th National Sci-Tech Festival Opens
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The 30th national sci-tech festival opened with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House here on Wednesday.
					 The festival is divided into 20 panels including agriculture, light industry, fishery and biology, basic science, energy, CNC, information, construction, land and environmental conservation and medical science.
					
					 The festival brought together officials and other people of more than 310 units which proved successful in sci-tech festivals of ministries, national institutions, universities and provinces (municipalities).
					
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Choe Thae Bok, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Vice-Premier Kim Yong Jin, Choe Sang Gon, chairman of the State Science and Technology Commission, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, Jang Chol, president of the State Academy of Sciences, officials concerned, scientists, technicians and members of three-revolution teams.

articles.title: National Symposium on Medical Science Held
articles.content:
National Symposium on Medical Science Held
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- A national symposium on medical science took place at the Grand People's Study House on Wednesday to mark the 30th anniversary of publication of leader Kim Jong Il's work "On the Further Improvement of the Health Service". 
					 The work, published on April 21, Juche 74 (1985), clarifies the essence of healthcare, the role of the healthcare for people in the revolution and construction and the tasks and ways for thoroughly carrying  out the party's policy of preventive medicine, improving and strengthening medical service and developing medical science and technology.
					
					 Kim Hyong Hun, chairman of the Central Committee of the Medical Association of Korea, said in a speech that the work is an immortal encyclopedia as it gives perfect answers to all theoretical and practical issues arising in developing the nation's public health onto a higher stage and finally settling the health issue of the working people.
					
					 He referred to the great achievements made in healthcare for the people thanks to the leadership of Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and devoted efforts of the health workers over the past three decades.
					
					 He called upon all the health workers to remain loyal to the leadership of Kim Jong Un, defend the socialist public health system of Juche and bring about a great turn in the healthcare this year marking the 70th anniversaries of Korea's liberation and the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The participants heard papers dealing with important issues in putting the healthcare onto a high scientific and technological basis and improving the work for preventing diseases.

articles.title: Socialist Emulation Called for
articles.content:
Socialist Emulation Called for
Unjon, April 22 (KCNA) -- The agricultural workers in Unjon County, North Phyongan Province held a meeting at the Unha Co-op Farm on Wednesday to finish rice transplanting and maize planting qualitatively in the right season this year.
					 A reporter and speakers underlined the need to successfully carry out the behests of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and devotedly implement the instructions of Marshal Kim Jong Un and the party's agricultural policy.
					
					 They stressed the need to strengthen the political work to give fullest play to the mental power of agricultural workers in immediate rice transplanting and maize planting.
					
					 They called for widely applying scientific farming methods including water-saving farming method and doing farming in a scientific and technological manner as required by the Juche farming method.
					
					 They called for carrying out the rice transplanting and maize planting as scheduled, registering great achievements in agricultural production and thus positively contributing to glorifying this significant year as a year of great victory and great revolutionary auspicious events.
					
					 They challenged the organizations of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea and agricultural workers across the country to a socialist emulation for winding up rice transplanting and maize planting qualitatively in the right season.

articles.title: Measuring Instrument for Coal Caloric Value Developed
articles.content:
Measuring Instrument for Coal Caloric Value Developed
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The Central Measuring Science Institute of the DPRK has developed a new kind of instrument for measuring the caloric value of coal.
					 According to Kang Sun Bom, section chief of the Institute, this computer-controlled instrument was manufactured with 100 percent local materials, ranging from designing to devices and software.
					
					 It is able to measure caloric value and ash content as well as heat value of all solid combustibles.
					
					 The measuring instrument meets the international standard.

articles.title: Japanese Bodies Condemn Authorities for Suppressing Chongryon
articles.content:
Japanese Bodies Condemn Authorities for Suppressing Chongryon
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Japanese organizations released statements on April 1 to denounced the authorities for suppressing the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon).
					 The Tokushima Prefectural People's Forum for Japan-DPRK Friendship condemned the police authorities' violence as an unreasonable search prompted by their political intention. 
					
					 They searched the houses of the chairman and a vice-chairman of the Chongryon Central Standing Committee who are deputies to the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, treating them as "criminals", it said, adding the violence is only touching off the enmity towards the Chongryon and the DPRK against Japan.
					
					 It demanded the government make an apology for the violence at once and make reparations for the victims and opt for normalizing Japan-DPRK diplomatic relations this year that marks the 70th anniversary of Japan's defeat in the war.
					
					 The Osaka Citizens Solidarity Demanding Earlier Normalization of the Relations between Japan and the DPRK strongly denounced the unreasonable search by the Abe regime, saying it is intolerable. It reaffirmed that it would wage a dynamic action for Japan's liquidation of its past crimes and early normalization of diplomatic relations based on the Japan-DPRK Pyongyang Declaration.

articles.title: Minju Joson Discloses Japanese Reactionaries' Aim of Revising "Law on Security"
articles.content:
Minju Joson Discloses Japanese Reactionaries' Aim of Revising "Law on Security"
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The Liberal Democratic Party and the New Komeito Party of Japan, coalition ruling parties of Japan, recently agreed on revising the "law on security" the keynote of which is that the "Self-Defense Forces" shall render support to the armies of the U.S. and other allies anytime and anywhere even though Japan is not directly attacked.
					 In case the law is revised, Japan will have the "right" to dispatch the SDF to any part of the world anytime.
					
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are advertising that the basic purpose of the revision is to ensure Japan's security and contribute to global "peace" and "stability." But this is no more than sophism to cover up its sinister purpose.
					
					 Japan is seeking to expand the scope of SDF's overseas activities in a bid to launch a war of aggression and realize its wild ambition for militarist overseas aggression.
					
					 Considering that it is essential to boost military muscle to become the "leader" of Asia, Japan has long sought to turn itself into a military giant.
					
					 What remains to be done by Japan is to dispatch its expanded armed forces overseas.
					
					 Some countries would fall victims to Japan's reinvasion and the U.S, too, would not avoid the war.
					
					 In a word, the U.S. would have to pay high price for opening Japan's way of overseas expansion.

articles.title: Anti-"Government" Action Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Anti-"Government" Action Staged in S. Korea
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- A fierce anti-"government" action took place in Seoul on April 18 on the lapse of one year since the ferry Sewol disaster.
					 The area around the Kwanghwamun plaza was crowded with more than 30 000 people from all walks of life including members of 500 civic and public organizations.
					
					 The puppet authorities mobilized at least 14 000 police, creating a terror-ridden atmosphere before the rally. The police walked off more than 20 including bereaved family members on their way to the plaza.
					
					 At the rally speakers denounced Park Geun Hye, chief executive of south Korea, for making foreign trips, abandoning the bereaved families and other people.
					
					 What the people want is to probe the truth about the disaster and salvage the ferry, they said, adding all people would continue actions to probe the truth.
					
					 At the end of the rally the participants launched a demonstration toward Chongwadae.
					
					 The fascist police totally blocked the road to Chongwadae with dozens of vehicles, firing water guns and tear gas liquid to demonstrators.
					
					 Enraged by this, they fought against the police, shoulder to shoulder, and waged a protest action to remove the police cars.
					
					 The demonstration took place till late night.
					
					 That day the fascist authorities walked off 100 demonstrators and detained them in different police stations in Seoul.

articles.title: Candlelight Rally Calls for Probe into Truth behind Ferry Sewol Disaster in S. Korea
articles.content:
Candlelight Rally Calls for Probe into Truth behind Ferry Sewol Disaster in S. Korea
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- A candlelight rally was held at Seoul Square of south Korea on Apr. 17 under the sponsorship of the People's Action for Democracy and the All-People Measure Council for Ferry Sewol Disaster.
					 Members of the bereaved families and thousands of citizens participated in the rally.
					
					 Speakers said the rally was sponsored to let the international community know about the actions of the south Korean people calling for finding those still missing, proper salvage of the sunken ferry and probe into the truth behind the disaster.
					
					 They said they would carry on their actions to have the ship salvaged and the "enforcement ordinance" retracted.
					
					 Then followed a ceremony in token of the tragic disaster.
					
					 The fascist security authorities hurled more than 11,000 police troops of 137 companies and 400 police buses into the venue of the rally, creating a terror-ridden atmosphere.

articles.title: S. Korean Regime Accused of Justifying Deployment of THAAD
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Accused of Justifying Deployment of THAAD
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Recently, a high-ranking official of the U.S. military made public that the U.S. has started a discussion on deployment of THAAD in south Korea. Earlier, the south Korean puppet authorities, when meeting with the U.S. military heavyweights on a visit to south Korea, called for "strengthening joint deterrent" to cope with the "ever more escalating nuclear threat from the north", crying out for making a "comprehensive judgment and decision" on the deployment of THAAD with the "nuclear threat from the north" as its primary subject.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a commentary observes in this regard:
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime has neither face nor qualifications to talk about "nuclear threat from the north."
					
					 The puppet regime has worked hard to invent a pretext for the deployment of THAAD by putting up the stereo-typed signboard of "nuclear threat from the north." This is such a foolish act as helping outsiders ignite a nuclear war against the Korean nation.
					
					 To launch a high-altitude missile to intercept an opponent's flying object with the short-depth Korean peninsula as an operational sphere is something hardly understandable with even common military knowledge. So, THAAD is not necessary in south Korea.
					
					 It is needless to say that THAAD the U.S. wants to deploy in south Korea is targeting the neighboring countries of the DPRK.
					
					 Consequently, the projected deployment of THAAD in south Korea is just a product of the U.S. strategic goal to contain the neighboring countries by establishing its MD system on the Korean peninsula and in other parts of Northeast Asia.
					
					 Nevertheless, the south Korean puppet regime is zealously supporting the U.S. deployment of THAAD, noisily talking about "nuclear threat from the north."
					
					 Now that the U.S. deployment of THAAD in south Korea has become a fait accompli, south Korea has undoubtedly turned into the most dangerous nuclear outpost of the U.S. and the worldwide hotbed of a nuclear war.

articles.title: S. Koreans Call for Fighting in Spirit of April 19 Popular Uprising
articles.content:
S. Koreans Call for Fighting in Spirit of April 19 Popular Uprising
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The Society of April Revolution, the Confederation of Trade Unions and the Solidarity for Progress in south Korea held a joint memorial service in Seoul on April 19, the 55th anniversary of the April 19 Popular Uprising.
					 Speakers expressed their indignation at the reality of south Korea where the spirit of the uprisers is being wantonly quenched.
					
					 They called for fighting in the spirit of the April 19 uprisers in order to overcome the present situation where actions for achieving democracy and movement for peaceful reunification are being suppressed and the life of popular masses is being deteriorated as days go by.
					
					 They called for staging dynamic all-people actions against the "yusin" dictatorial rule and advancing along the road of independence, democracy and reunification to end the 70 year-long national division.

articles.title: S. Korean PM Accused of Mocking at Spirit of April 19 Popular Uprising
articles.content:
S. Korean PM Accused of Mocking at Spirit of April 19 Popular Uprising
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Some media of south Korea accused the "prime minister" of south Korea of mocking at the spirit of the April 19 popular uprising.
					 Kyunghyang Daily News on Apr. 19 recalled that the "prime minister" received 30 million won from Song Wan Jong, former chairman of the Kyongnam Business Group, as a political fund, adding that not only the opposition parties but also the ruling party are demanding him step down.
					
					 He deleted the sentence "the government is pushing ahead with a wholesale reform to root out graft and corruption" from his address made at a ceremony marking the anniversary of the uprising out of his awareness of his position, the daily news noted.
					
					 The south Korean internet paper Voice of People on Apr. 20 recalled that the "prime minister" made an address in the capacity of representative of the "government" at the above-said event.
					
					 He is not entitled to stand before the graves of the brave participants in the uprising as it was popular resistance against fraudulent election and corruption of the Syngman-Rhee regime, the paper noted.
					
					 It urged him to step down.

articles.title: Koreans in U.S. Continue Action for Probing Truth about Ferry Sewol Disaster
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Continue Action for Probing Truth about Ferry Sewol Disaster
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Koreans in the U.S. staged an action in New York on April 19 to honor the memory of the victims of the ferry Sewol disaster and demand the probe into the truth about it one year since the disaster, according to Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 They staged a demonstration carrying the photos of students of Tanwon Senior High School in Ansan City, Kyonggi Province of south Korea who met grievous death due to the disaster.
					
					 The demonstrators held a memorial service in Manhattan.
					
					 Korean religionists held similar services in New York on April 16 and 18.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Indonesian Paper
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Feats Praised by Indonesian Paper
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The Indonesian paper International Media on April 8 devoted one whole page to a special write-up under the headline of "Congratulations on Korea's Day of Sun" on the occasions of the Day of the Sun (the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung) and the 50th anniversary of the Indonesia visit by the President and leader Kim Jong Il and the 50th anniversary of the naming of a beautiful flower Kimilsungia.
					 It said that the President performed ideological and theoretical feats to be specially recorded in the history of human thought.
					
					 It praised him for performing feats by building the party, army and state. It went on: He was the distinguished leader who steered the cause of global independence.
					
					 By putting forward the slogan "The World People Advocating Independence, Unite!" he sincerely helped the national independence of many countries and their independent development and conducted energetic activities to strengthen the socialist movement, the non-aligned movement and other progressive movements aspiring after independence against imperialism.
					
					 The paper introduced his whole life characterized by his love for people, saying he was called "the fatherly leader" in his lifetime and is revered as "the eternal President of the DPRK" by the people even after his demise.

articles.title: Seminars on Exploits of Kim Il Sung Held in Different Countries
articles.content:
Seminars on Exploits of Kim Il Sung Held in Different Countries
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Seminars on exploits of President Kim Il Sung took place in Mongolia, Nepal, the Czech Republic, Sweden, DR Congo and Colombia from April 4 to 10.
					 Displayed at the venues of the seminars were photos dealing with immortal feats of Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were their works, and books and photos introducing the struggle of the army and people of the DPRK making a general offensive for the final victory.
					
					 The mayor of a city in Ovorhangay Province of Mongolia said that it would have been unthinkable without the feats of the President that Korea, deprived of its sovereignty by big powers one century ago, has defended the sovereignty while leading the trend of the world.
					
					 The chairman of the Nepalese Association for Supporting the Songun Politics and other speakers praised the President as an outstanding leader who led to victory the national liberation struggle in colonial countries, democratic revolution and socialist revolution and thus made an immortal contribution to the cause of global independence.
					
					 The deputy general secretary of the C.C., the Czechoslovak Communist Party said that the President liberated the country through armed struggle, founded the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK, wisely led the revolution and construction under the uplifted banner of the Juche idea and thus built the socialist state. 
					
					 The secretary of the National Executive Committee of the People's Party for the Reconstruction and the Democracy of DR Congo noted that the President will be immortal as the mental pillar of the progressive people struggling for independence and justice.
					
					 Congratulatory messages to Kim Jong Un were adopted at the seminars held in Mongolia, Nepal and Sweden.

articles.title: Exploits of Kim Il Sung Lauded by Foreign Papers
articles.content:
Exploits of Kim Il Sung Lauded by Foreign Papers
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried special write-ups illustrated with photos of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the Day of the Sun (the birth anniversary of the President).
					 The Indian paper Indian and World Event on April 3 devoted two whole pages to articles titled "Rare strategist" and "People's father" under the headline of "Eternal sun of Juche".
					
					 The paper said that the President met with more than 70 000 foreigners including leaders of political parties, states and governments of 136 countries all his life and rendered material and moral assistance to the national liberation struggle, anti-imperialist struggle and building of new society in many countries of the world.
					
					 The President, who ushered in the era of independence and dedicated his all to the victorious advance of the human cause of independence, will always live as the eternal sun of Juche in the hearts of all the people of the world aspiring after independence, the paper noted. 
					
					 The Malaysian paper Guang Ming Daily on April 4 in an article said that the President founded the immortal Juche idea, defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists, wisely led the postwar rehabilitation and construction and socialist construction and thus built the socialist system centered on the popular masses in the DPRK.
					
					 A paper of Libya on April 8 noted that through his original Songun revolutionary leadership the President achieved the historic cause of the country's liberation, won the shining victory in the three year-long Fatherland Liberation War and wisely led the DPRK to exercise its sovereignty on the international arena.
					
					 The Hungarian paper Liberation on April 10 said that the Korean people are highly praising the President as the national hero and the people's leader as he defeated the Japanese and U.S. imperialists.

articles.title: Day of Sun Celebrated in Cuba
articles.content:
Day of Sun Celebrated in Cuba
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- A meeting, photo exhibition and film show took place at the Chollima Shipyard on April 13 under the co-sponsorship of the Cuban Institute of Friendship with the Peoples and the Cuban Committee for Supporting Korea's Reunification on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun).
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos dealing with the revolutionary career and immortal feats of the President.
					
					 Present there were personages of the institute, the committee and shipyard and other masses. The DPRK ambassador to Cuba and his embassy officials were present on invitation.
					
					 Juan Jose Leon, first vice-chairman of the committee, said:
					
					 The President, born into a patriotic and revolutionary family, embarked on the road of revolution in his teens and liberated the country through arduous armed struggle.
					
					 He founded the DPRK after the liberation of the country and led to victory the Korean war ignited by the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 He reconstructed the country which had been reduced to ashes by the war, wisely led socialist construction and thus built the socialist power independent in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliant in national defence.
					
					 The President, the great leader of the Korean people, put forward the fair proposals for national reunification, providing a cornerstone for Korea's reunification and making an immortal contribution to the cause of global independence.
					
					 We will as ever strive for the reunification of the Korean peninsula.
					
					 The participants looked round photos on display and enjoyed a Korean film "Masikryong Ski Resort".

articles.title: Day of Sun Marked Abroad
articles.content:
Day of Sun Marked Abroad
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- There took place meetings in Russia, Belarus, Moldova and Ukraine on April 12 and 13 in celebration of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung (the Day of the Sun).
					 Andrei Dmitriyev, chairman of the All-Russian Society for the Study and Dissemination of Kimilsungism, praised the President for fathering the immortal Juche idea to illuminate the way ahead of mankind.
					
					 Oleg Novikov, chairman of the February 16 Society for the Study of Juche Idea and Songun Politics of Belarus, said the President thoroughly rejected factionalism and flunkeyism in the whole period of his revolutionary activities and that the principle of independence clarified by him served as the almighty guidelines for state and party building.
					
					 The chairman of the Songun revolution anti-imperialist association for the study of the Juche idea in Moldova praised the President as an invincible and iron-willed brilliant commander who defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists in one generation.
					
					 Nikolai Polishk, chairman of the Ukrainian "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea, said that the issue of succession to the leadership was successfully settled in the DPRK and thereby socialism has been reliably defended, adding: The Korean people are vigorously stepping up the building of a thriving nation under the leadership of the great party.
					
					 Congratulatory messages to Marshal Kim Jong Un were adopted at the meetings held in Belarus, Moldova and Ukraine.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Brazil
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Brazil
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us March Forward Dynamically towards Final Victory, Holding Higher the Banner of Songun" was brought out in pamphlet by the Asa Copias Publishing House of Brazil on April 14.
					 The speech made by him at the military parade for celebrating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung on April 15, Juche 101 (2012), says that the 100 year-long history of Kim Il Sung's nation clearly proves the immutable truth that outstanding leaders assure the dignity and prosperity of the country and the nation.
					
					 It sets forth the tasks to be fulfilled to glorify the dignity of Songun Korea for all ages and successfully carry out the cause of building a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: Nigerian Body Introduces Masikryong Ski Resort in DPRK
articles.content:
Nigerian Body Introduces Masikryong Ski Resort in DPRK
Pyongyang, April 22 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on April 12 posted on its website an article titled "Enthusiasm for skiing on Masik Pass".
					 The article said that these days there are growing enthusiasm for skiing on Masik Pass in the DPRK, introducing in detail the Masikryong Ski Resort.
					
					 What the world sees through the ski resort is the DPRK's building of a highly civilized socialist country, the article said, adding:
					
					 The DPRK is making a dynamic leap forward towards the eminence of the highly civilized country.
					
					 It was supreme leader Kim Jong Un who brought about such enthusiasm for skiing.
					
					 After visiting the ski resort, many foreigners said with admiration that it is a world-class ski resort.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige hospicio y orfanato de Wonsan en visperas de inauguracion
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige hospicio y orfanato de Wonsan en visperas de inauguracion
Pyongyang, 22 de abril (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio en el terreno el hospicio y orfanato de Wonsan en visperas de inauguracion.
					Mirando el panorama de edificios, dijo que estan a punto de terminarlos en el lugar donde hace dos meses se veian solo los armazones y polvos y agrego con satisfaccion que ahora los alrededores de esa zona se han convertido muy maravillosamente.
					
					Anadio que gracias al levantamiento de las casas elegantes en el paraiso socialista, podemos satisfacer uno de los legados de los grandes Lideres quienes prestaban siempre gran atencion a los huerfanos.
					
					Recorriendo varios puntos de los edificios el Mariscal hizo detallado conocimiento de la marcha de la obra.
					
					Evaluo altamente que fueron perfectamente acondicionadas la biblioteca infantil, todas las salas de crianza y educacion, observacion natural, juegos, diversion combinada, asistencia medica, etc., la piscina, el bano y la barberia.
					
					Subrayo que fueron ubicadas armoniosa y racionalmente todas las instalaciones para que se contribuyan a la crianza, la ensenanza y educacion, el crecimiento y desarrollo de inteligencia y los elementos fueron formados conforme al mundo infantil de los ninos para que se les infundan la creatividad y la independencia.
					
					Al decir contento que en la obra se utilizaron los materiales nacionales de acabado de talla mundial, entre otros el azulejo de paredes exterior e interior, los muebles sanitarios y las tablas de goma para cubrir el suelo al aire libre, lo que demuestra que se lograron muchos exitos en la materializacion de la orientacion del partido de fabricar por propia cuenta los materiales de construccion.
					
					Enfatizo que los dos edificios son vistosos, a traves de lo cual se da cuenta del notable desarrollo de nuestro diseno y la obra.
					
					Destaco que el hospicio y orfanato estan en etapa crucial, por tanto, deben hacer bien los preparativos de gestion, tales como la formacion de criadoras y educadoras y el suministro suficiente de los equipamientos escolares, los muebles y utensilios necesarios y los materiales de administracion. 
					
					Al volver a contemplar los edificios, senalo que son excelentes, esta muy contento, se levanto un palacio de los ninos dignos de ser transmitido al mundo el amor del partido por las generaciones venideras y el futuro. Y anadio que le parece ver los aspectos de los ninos que juegan a sus anchas sin ninguna envidia en el mundo y que el mismo haya traido la estrella del cielo.
					
					Evaluo los esfuerzos de los constructores militares que libraron incansables esfuerzos por dar alegria al pueblo y les dio agradecimiento del Comandante Supremo del EPC tras encomendar que se le entregue sin falta su saludo.
					
					Refirio que los constructores militares deben terminar las obras restantes con el sentimiento de encargarse de mil anos y garantizar diez mil anos, y les exhorto a realizar solemnemente el primero de junio, Dia Internacional de la Infancia, la ceremonia inaugural del hospicio y el orfanato.
					
					Le acompano el vicemariscal Hwang Pyong So, jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un recibe cesto de flores y carta de felicitacion de agregados militares
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un recibe cesto de flores y carta de felicitacion de agregados militares
Pyongyang, 22 de abril (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un recibio un cesto de flores y una carta de felicitacion que con motivo del 83o aniversario de la fundacion del Ejercito Popular de Corea, le dedicara el Cuerpo de Agregados Militares en Corea. 
					El agregado militar de la embajada china en Corea, Zhang Ping, quien preside el Cuerpo, los entrego el dia 22 al general de ejercito de las fuerzas terrestres del EPC, Hyon Yong Chol, ministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares.

articles.title: Efectuado seminario nacional de ciencias medicas
articles.content:
Efectuado seminario nacional de ciencias medicas
Pyongyang, 22 de abril (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar este miercoles en el Palacio de Estudio del Pueblo el seminario nacional sobre las ciencias medicas en conmemoracion del 30o aniversario de publicacion de la obra maestra del Dirigente Kim Jong Il "Para un mayor mejoramiento e intensificacion de la labor de salud publica".
					El trabajo publicado el 21 de abril del 74 (1985) de la Era Juche indica la esencia de la labor de salud publica y su papel que ocupa en la revolucion y la construccion. Ademas aclara las tareas y los remedios para materializar cabalmente la orientacion profilactica del partido, mejorar el trabajo de servicio medico y desarrollar las ciencias y tecnicas medicas.
					
					El orador Kim Hyong Hun, presidente del Comite Central de la Asociacion de Medicos de Corea, senalo que la obra es una inmortal coleccion que dio una perfecta respuesta a todos los problemas ideo-teoricos que se presentan en asentar la salud publica del pais en la etapa mas alta y solucionar radicalmente el problema sanitario de las masas trabajadoras. 
					
					Se refirio a que durante 30 anos pasados se lograron en la labor de salud publica notables exitos gracias a la direccion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il y el Mariscal Kim Jong Un y a los ingentes esfuerzos de los funcionarios del sector de salud publica.
					
					Exhorto a todos los funcionarios sanitarios a seguir fielmente la guia del Mariscal, defender el autoctono regimen de salud publica socialista y obtener grandes cambios en la salud publica de este ano en que se cumplira el septuagesimo aniversario de la liberacion de la patria y la fundacion del partido.
					
					Se publicaron las disertaciones que reflejan valiosos asuntos en asentar el trabajo sanitario en el elevado cimiento cientifico-tecnico y mejorar la labor preventiva de enfermedades.

articles.title: Minju Joson revela meta de reaccionarios japoneses para enmendar "ley de seguridad"
articles.content:
Minju Joson revela meta de reaccionarios japoneses para enmendar "ley de seguridad"
Pyongyang, 22 de abril (ACNC) -- Recientemente, el Partido Democratico Liberal y el Partido Komeito, partidos gobernantes de coalicion, acordaron enmendar la "ley de seguridad" cuyo nucleo es que las "fuerzas de autodefensa" puedan ofrecer ayuda en cualquier tiempo y lugar a los ejercitos de EE.UU. y otros paises aliados aunque no haya la ofensiva directa a Japon.
					Si esa "ley" quede enmendada, el pais obtendra el "derecho" a despachar cuando quiera a todos los puntos del mundo sus "fuerzas de autodefensa".
					
					Los reaccionarios japoneses anuncian que su enmienda es para hacer contribucion al aseguramiento de seguridad de Japon y a la "paz" y la "estabilidad" del mundo, pero esto no pasa de ser un disparate para encubrir su malsano objetivo.
					
					Asi revela el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual de hoy y prosigue:
					
					El pais isla persigue expandir la esfera de actividades de sus "fuerzas de autodefensa" en el extranjero no para la seguridad de si mismo y la paz mundial sino para provocar la guerra de agresion y realizar su ambicion de agresion militarista a  ultramar.
					
					Desde hace mucho tiempo, Japon calculo que es indispensable expandir su poderio militar para convertirse en el caudillo de Asia y se desespero por su conversion en la potencia militar.
					
					Ya que se expandio al maximo su poderio militar, lo que se le queda es despachar a ultramar sus fuerzas y aprovecharlas a sus anchas.
					
					En el caso de que se realice la expansion a ultramar de los efectivos japoneses, es obvio que varios paises del mundo sean victimas de la guerra de reagresion de Japon, y Estados Unidos tampoco evitara el estrago.
					
					En una palabra, el imperio pagara el caro precio por haber permitido a Japon la expansion militarista a ultramar.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun rechaza emplazamiento de THAAD en el Sur de Corea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun rechaza emplazamiento de THAAD en el Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 22 de abril (ACNC) -- Hace pocos dias, un alto funcionario del circulo militar de Estados Unidos anuncio que esta en discusion el emplazamiento de THAAD en el Sur de Corea. Con anterioridad, las autoridades surcoreanas se reunieron con los caudillos de la capa militar norteamericana, de visita en el Sur de Corea, ocasion en la cual insistieron en "consolidar el disuasivo conjunto" frente a la "creciente amenaza nuclear del Norte de Corea" y "juzgar y decidir comprensivamente" el emplazamiento de THAAD teniendo en cuenta la "amenaza nuclear del Norte de Corea". 
					Los titeres surcoreanos no tienen la cara ni la calificacion para hablar de la "amenaza nuclear del Norte de Corea".
					
					Senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este miercoles y continua:
					
					Es incomprensible con conocimientos militares elementales lanzar el misil contra la parte Norte tomando como escenario operacional la Peninsula Coreana de poca profundidad. 
					
					Pues, para el Sur de Corea no se le hace falta el THAAD. 
					
					La verdadera intencion de EE.UU. es mantener a rayas a las potencias perifericas de Corea. 
					
					En fin de cuentas, el emplazamiento de THAAD en el Sur de Corea es el producto de la meta estrategicas de EE.UU. de establecer el sistema de defensa antimisil en la Peninsula Corana y el resto del Nordeste Asiatico y mantener a rayas a las potencias perifericas. 
					
					Sin embargo, los titeres surcoreanos instigan el emplazamiento de THAAD hablando de la "amenaza nuclear del Norte de Corea". 
					
					Indudablemente, el Sur de Corea es la zona avanzada nuclear mas peligrosa de EE.UU. y origen de la guerra nuclear mundial.
